{{Use dmy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2016}} {{Infobox football biography |name = Kieran Dowell |image = |image_size = |caption = |fullname = Kieran O'Neill Dowell{{cite web |title=Barclays Premier League Squad Lists 2014/15 published |url=http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2014-15/sep/premier-league-squad-lists-2014-2015.html |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=11 December 2014 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150105225000/http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/news/news/2014-15/sep/premier-league-squad-lists-2014-2015.html |archivedate=5 January 2015}} |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1997|10|10|df=y}}{{cite web |title=Kieran Dowell |url=http://www.11v11.com/players/kieran-dowell-248413/ |website=11v11.com |accessdate=16 April 2016}} |birth_place = [[Ormskirk]], England |height = {{convert|1.75|m|order=flip}}{{cite web |url=https://www.premierleague.com/players/10455/Kieran-Dowell/overview |title=Kieran Dowell: Overview |publisher=Premier League |accessdate=28 July 2018}} |position = [[Midfielder#Attacking midfielder|Attacking midfielder]] |currentclub = [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] (On loan from [[Everton F.C.|Everton]]) |clubnumber = 8 |youthyears1 = 2005–2014 |youthclubs1 = [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton]] |years1 = 2014– |clubs1 = [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] |caps1 = 2 |goals1 = 0 |years2 = 2017–2018 |clubs2 = → [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]] (loan) |caps2 = 38 |goals2 = 9 |years3 = 2019– |clubs3 = → [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] (loan) |caps3 = 8 |goals3 = 1 | nationalyears1 = 2012 | nationalteam1 = [[England national under-16 football team|England U16]] | nationalcaps1 = 1 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2013–2014 | nationalteam2 = [[England national under-17 football team|England U17]] | nationalcaps2 = 7 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | nationalyears3 = 2014–2015 | nationalteam3 = [[England national under-18 football team|England U18]] | nationalcaps3 = 3 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | nationalyears4 = 2016–2017 | nationalteam4 = [[England national under-20 football team|England U20]] | nationalcaps4 = 16 | nationalgoals4 = 1 | nationalyears5 = 2017– | nationalteam5 = [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] | nationalcaps5 = 11 | nationalgoals5 = 2 | medaltemplates = | club-update = 19:31, 23 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 18:30, 16 October 2018 (UTC) }} '''Kieran O'Neill Dowell''' (born 10 October 1997) is an English professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Everton F.C.|Everton]] and [[England national under-21 football team|England under-21 team]]. ==Club career== ===Everton=== Born in [[Ormskirk]], Lancashire, Dowell joined Everton's academy at the age of 7.{{cite web |title=Kieran Dowell |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/players/k/kd/kieran-dowell |publisher=Everton F.C. |accessdate=11 December 2014}} After progressing through the ranks and the reserve side, he signed a scholarship with the club in June 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/06/28/15-become-scholars |title=15 Become Scholars |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=28 June 2014 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104135538/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/06/28/15-become-scholars |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/26/next-generation-kieran-dowell |title=Next Generation: Kieran Dowell |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=26 May 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104143842/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/05/26/next-generation-kieran-dowell |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} He then scored in a friendly for the [[Everton F.C. Reserves and Academy|Everton U21]] side, in a 1–0 win over [[Rhyl F.C.|Rhyl]] on 26 July 2014.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/07/26/report-everton-u21s-10-rhyl |title=Report: Everton U21s 1–0 Rhyl |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=26 July 2014 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104131758/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2014/07/26/report-everton-u21s-10-rhyl |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} Dowell made his debut for the club on 11 December 2014, replacing the injured [[Christian Atsu]] 11 minutes into a [[UEFA Europa League]] group match against [[FC Krasnodar]] at [[Goodison Park]]. Everton, who had already advanced into the next round, lost 0–1.{{cite news |title=Everton 0–1 FK Krasnodar |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/30333966 |accessdate=11 December 2014 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 December 2014}} With his only first team appearances of the season, he signed his first professional contract with the club. After being given a number 51 shirt in the 2015–16 season, Dowell, however, suffered ankle injury that saw him sidelined for two months.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/09/02/aaron-opts-for-12-shirt |title=Lennon To Wear Number 12 |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=2 September 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104133616/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2015/09/02/aaron-opts-for-12-shirt |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Everton prospect Kieran Dowell could miss two months after ankle surgery |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/everton-prospect-kieran-dowell-could-9893322 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=20 August 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} He scored on his return for the Everton U21 on 6 December 2015, in a 3–1 win over [[Liverpool F.C. Reserves and Academy|Liverpool U23]].{{cite news |title=Are these two Everton's midfield axis of the future? |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/two-evertons-midfield-axis-future-10557508 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=6 December 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell went on to score nine more goals for the reserve side, including a stunner against [[Southampton F.C. Under-23s and Academy|Southampton U21]] and a hat-trick against [[Leicester City F.C. Reserves and Academy|Leicester City U23]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2015-2016/barclays-premier-u21-league/everton-u21-vs-southampton-u21/match |title=Match Report: Everton U21 v Southampton U21 |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=15 February 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170204231438/http://www.evertonfc.com/fixtures/2010-to-2019/2015-2016/barclays-premier-u21-league/everton-u21-vs-southampton-u21/match |archivedate=4 February 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Watch Kieran Dowell's stunning Everton hat trick as he continues to knock on first-team door |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/watch-kieran-dowells-stunning-everton-11242511 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=26 April 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} On 30 April 2016, he made his [[Premier League]] debut as an 87th-minute substitute for [[Ross Barkley]] in a 2–1 home win over [[A.F.C. Bournemouth|Bournemouth]].{{cite news |title=Everton 2 – 1 AFC Bournemouth |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36118581 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=30 April 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell then started the final game of the 2015–16 season against [[Norwich City F.C.|Norwich City]] at Goodison Park.{{cite news |title=Everton 3 – 1 Norwich City |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36240381 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=15 May 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Two months after making his Premier League debut, Dowell signed a three-year contract with the club, keeping him until 2019.{{cite news |title=Kieran Dowell signs revised three-year contract with Everton |url=http://www.espn.co.uk/football/everton/story/2900715/kieran-dowell-signs-revised-three-year-contract-with-everton |publisher=ESPN |date=23 June 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} In the 2016–17 season, Dowell was a member of the Everton U23 squad to win the inaugural Premier League 2 title, in which he made the total of 22 appearances and scoring 5 times.{{cite news |title=Meet new Nottingham Forest signing Kieran Dowell – the teenager with a cracking shot and fine left foot |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/football-news/meet-new-nottingham-forest-signing-276535 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/04/25/under23s-story-of-the-season |title=Under-23s: Story of the season |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=25 April 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150326/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/04/25/under23s-story-of-the-season |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} His performance throughout April won him April's Premier League 2 Player of the Month.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/12/honour-for-under23s-midfielder |title=Under-23s Midfielder Wins Award |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=12 May 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150044/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/12/honour-for-under23s-midfielder |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} ====Nottingham Forest (loan)==== On 3 August 2017, Dowell signed on a season-long loan with [[EFL Championship|Championship]] side [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].{{cite web |url=https://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/2017/august/dowell-joins-on-loan/ |title=Dowell joins on loan |publisher=Nottingham Forest F.C. |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104160619/https://www.nottinghamforest.co.uk/news/2017/august/dowell-joins-on-loan/ |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite news |title=Done deal: Kieran Dowell joins Nottingham Forest on season-long loan from Everton |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/transfer-news/done-deal-kieran-dowell-joins-267717 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell made his Nottingham Forest debut, coming on as a second-half substitute, in a 1–0 win over [[Millwall F.C.|Millwall]] in the opening game of the season.{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest 1 – 0 Millwall |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40748927 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=3 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} He scored his first goal for Forest in a 4–3 win at [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] on 12 August 2017.{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40834645 |title=Brentford 3–4 Nottingham Forest |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 August 2017 |accessdate=14 August 2017}} Since making his Nottingham Forest debut, he became a first team regular.{{cite news |title=Kieran Dowell, Barrie McKay and Tendayi Darikwa earn top marks from Nottingham Forest fans as they 'Rate The Players' |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/kieran-dowell-barrie-mckay-tendayi-287284 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=6 August 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest's Kieran Dowell loving 'every minute' of whirlwind few months in his career |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/nottingham-forests-kieran-dowell-loving-417376 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=3 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Dowell scored again on 30 September 2017, in a 2–1 win over [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]].{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest 2–1 Sheffield United: Blades charge ends |url=http://www.skysports.com/football/n-forest-vs-sheff-utd/374746 |publisher=Sky Sports |date=30 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} Four weeks later, on 28 October 2017, he scored his first ever hat-trick, in a 3–2 win over [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].{{cite news |title=Hull City 2 – Nottingham Forest 3: Kieran Dowell hits hat-trick to tame Tigers |url=http://www.express.co.uk/sport/football/872299/Hull-City-Nottingham-Forest-Live-Stream-Championship |newspaper=Daily Express |date=28 October 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} After the match, Dowell's performance was praised by local newspaper ''[[Nottingham Post]]'' and the club's supporters.{{cite news |title=Nottingham Forest hat-trick hero Kieran Dowell scored two 'absolute belters' |url=http://www.nottinghampost.com/sport/football/nottingham-forest-hat-trick-hero-695854 |newspaper=Nottingham Post |date=28 October 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} ==== Sheffield United (loan) ==== On 28 December 2018, it was announced that Dowell would join [[Sheffield United F.C.|Sheffield United]] as of 2 January 2019 on loan for the rest of the season. ==International career== After representing England at lower youth levels, Dowell was selected for the [[England national under-20 football team|England under-20 team]] for the first time, making his debut in a 1–1 draw against [[Brazil national under-20 football team|Brazil]] alongside Everton teammate [[Dominic Calvert-Lewin]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/01/international-blues |title=International Blues |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=1 September 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104144833/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/01/international-blues |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/02/international-round-up |title=International Round-Up |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=2 September 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104144840/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2016/09/02/international-round-up |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} In May 2017, Dowell was selected for the England U20 in the [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/25/dowell-raring-to-go |title=Dowell Raring To Go |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=25 May 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150544/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/05/25/dowell-raring-to-go |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} After setting up two goals in a 3–0 win over [[Argentina national under-20 football team|Argentina]] on Matchday 1 of the group stage, he scored the only goal against hosts [[South Korea national under-20 football team|South Korea]], ensuring a place in the second round for England.{{cite news |title=Under-20 World Cup: England beat Argentina 3–0 in opening match |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/39984863 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=20 May 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}
{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2017/may/26/england-progress-under-20-world-cup |title=Everton's Kieran Dowell seals top spot for England at Under-20 World Cup |date=26 May 2017 |newspaper=The Guardian}} He also started in the final, in which England beat [[Venezuela national under-20 football team|Venezuela]] 1–0 for England's first triumph in a global tournament since their [[1966 FIFA World Cup|World Cup]] victory in 1966.{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40237981 |title=Under-20 World Cup: England beat Venezuela in final |publisher=BBC Sport |date=11 June 2017}} Following the end of the 2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup, Dowell was called up to the [[England national under-21 football team|England U21]] squad, for whom he made his debut in a 1–1 draw with [[Netherlands national under-21 football team|Netherlands U21]] on 1 September 2017.{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/28/blues-world-cup-winners-in-england-under21-squad |title=Five Blues Named in England Under-21s Squad |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=28 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104151957/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/28/blues-world-cup-winners-in-england-under21-squad |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}}
{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/01/calvert-lewin-on-target-for-young-lions |title=Calvert-Lewin on target for Young Lions |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=1 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104152041/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/09/01/calvert-lewin-on-target-for-young-lions |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} ==Personal life== Born in [[Ormskirk]], England, Dowell grew up supporting Everton, the team he would eventually play for, and idolised [[Mikel Arteta]].{{cite web |url=http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/01/my-football-hero-kieran-dowell |title=My Football Hero: Kieran Dowell |publisher=Everton F.C. |date=1 July 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171104150625/http://www.evertonfc.com/news/2017/07/01/my-football-hero-kieran-dowell |archivedate=4 November 2017 |deadurl=no}} While at the academy, he was a ball-boy when he was 14.{{cite news |title=Everton starlet Kieran Dowell Q&A;: Studying David Silva, worshipping Arteta and itching for a first team chance |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-starlet-kieran-dowell-qa-11082083 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=26 March 2016 |accessdate=4 November 2017}} At 20, he moved out of his parents' house for an apartment.{{cite news |title=Everton youngster Kieran Dowell on Nottingham Forest, England and... getting his Sky fixed |url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/everton-youngster-kieran-dowell-nottingham-13565892 |newspaper=Liverpool Echo |date=3 September 2017 |accessdate=4 November 2017}}
